pyccel.commands package¶

Submodules¶

pyccel.commands.console module¶

class pyccel.commands.console.MyParser(prog=None, usage=None, description=None, epilog=None, parents=[], formatter_class=<class 'argparse.HelpFormatter'>, prefix_chars='-', fromfile_prefix_chars=None, argument_default=None, conflict_handler='error', add_help=True, allow_abbrev=True, exit_on_error=True)[source]¶

Bases: argparse.ArgumentParser

Custom argument parser for printing help message in case of an error. See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4042452/display-help-message-with-python-argparse-when-script-is-called-without-any-argu

error(message: string)[source]¶

Prints a usage message incorporating the message to stderr and exits.

If you override this in a subclass, it should not return – it should either exit or raise an exception.

pyccel.commands.console.pyccel(files=None, mpi=None, openmp=None, openacc=None, output_dir=None, compiler=None)[source]¶

pyccel console command.

pyccel.commands.pyccel_clean module¶

Module containing scripts to remove pyccel generated objects

pyccel.commands.pyccel_clean.pyccel_clean(path_dir=None, recursive=True, remove_shared_libs=False, remove_programs=False)[source]¶

Remove __pyccel__ and __epyccel__ folders as well as any python shared libraries from the directory path_dir

Parameters

  • path_dir (str) – The path to the folder which should be cleaned Default : current working directory

  • recursive (bool) – Indicates whether the function should recurse into sub-folders Default : True

  • remove_shared_libs (bool) – Indicates whether shared libraries generated by python should also be removed from the directory path_dir

  • remove_programs (bool) – Indicates whether programs should also be removed from the directory path_dir

pyccel.commands.pyccel_clean.pyccel_clean_command()[source]¶

Wrapper around the pyccel_clean function allowing command line arguments to be passed to the function

pyccel.commands.pyccel_init module¶

Module containing script to pyccelize internal files

pyccel.commands.pyccel_init.pyccel_init()[source]¶

Pickle internal pyccel files

pyccel.commands.pyccel_init.pyccel_init_command()[source]¶

Wrapper around the pyccel_init function removing the need for ArgumentParser
